citation.article-title: Desulforhopalus vacuolatus gen. nov., sp. nov., a new moderately psychrophilic sulfate-reducing bacterium with gas vacuoles isolated from a temperate estuary.

p.s: Desulforhopalus (De.sul.fo.rhó.pa.lus. L. pref. de from; L. n. sulfo sulfur; L. n. rhopalus cudgel; M.L. masc. n. Desulforhopalus cudgel-formed sulfate reducer)
Oval-shaped, variable length, vacuolated, single or in chains.
Anaerobic chemo-organotroph; metabolism respiratory and fermentative.
Sulfate and other sulfur compounds serve as electron acceptors and are reduced to sulfide.
Propionate and other fermentation products are used as electron donors and carbon sources.
Acetate is formed as end product of incomplete oxidation.
The G+C content of the type species is 48.4 ± 0.3 mol%.
The type species is Desulforhopalus vacuolatus.
